text: Nested loop comparison in Python,Java and C
The following code in python takes very long to run.
(I couldn't wait until the program ended, though my friend told me for him it took 20 minutes.
But the equivalent code in Java runs in approximately 8 seconds and in C it takes 45 seconds.
I expected Python to be slow but not this much, and in case of C which I expected to be faster than Java was actually slower.
Is the JVM using some loop unrolling technique to achieve this speed?
Is there any reason for Python being so slow?

code:
import time
st=time.time()
for i in xrange(0,100000):
    for j in xrange(0,100000):
        continue;
print "Time taken : ",time.time()-st
